justification: “Clinical diagnosis, based on an evaluation of motor symptoms with the Unified Huntington's Disease Rating Scale (UHDRS), is generally made…”
“Participants were evaluated with the UHDRS, the Mattis Dementia Rating Scale (MDRS)….”
The same sentence notes that participants were given “the forward digit span test,” indicating it was used to measure memory span capacity.
Participants were also assessed with “the categorical fluency test,” a standard instrument for measuring verbal fluency.
Early-stage patients were classified using “stages I and II of the classification based on UHDRS total functional capacity (TFC) score,” showing TFC is the metric for functional capacity.
Premanifest status was defined by “a TFC of 13 and a Total Motor Score (TMS) < 5,” indicating TMS quantifies motor severity.
MRI analyses examined correlations with the “disease burden score (Penney et al., 1997),” implying that score operationalises disease burden.
The study correlated gray-matter volume with results from “symbol digit modalities test (SDMT),” showing SDMT was used to assess processing speed.
Gray-matter correlations also included “Stroop interference,” indicating the Stroop interference measure indexed inhibitory control.

measured_by: Drift Diffusion Model (DDM) parameters (decision boundary, drift rate, bias, non-decision time)
justification: The authors state they “used the drift diffusion model (DDM) to assess decision-making and core linguistic processing separately,” so DDM parameters operationalise decision-making.
